commit_message:
Fix keystone v3 support with swift backend

Refactor configuration for mitaka onwards, where the
authentication details for swift storage are in a new
glance-swift.conf configuration file.

Update for Keystone v3 support as required for
queens or later, where the v2 API has been dropped.

Closes-Bug: 1752027
Depends-On: Ie6e2733f34de10a4d34b18dbf1fd9ba623af0e18
Change-Id: Ibcc36ca22d72d310921f840e6081608be1fbc7e1
(cherry picked from commit 4d1d7f5a3f9fbaf1bffa3384e037e40a2b54b677)

subject: Update the doc links to the newest ones
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-03-20 07:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/config.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/horizon.conf', 'releasenotes/notes/openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard-da1b1556e30aa858.yaml', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/openstack-service-api/cinder.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py', 'horizon/middleware/base.py'], 'message': 'Update the doc links to the newest ones

The docstring of getExtensions service in cinder.service.js
was a copy from nova service and not correct. The docstring was
updated based on the current cinder v2 API.

Thanks to a recent improvement in reno, touching release notes
in older releases in the master branch no longer polute the rendered
release notes. Changing URLs (or other things) in the master branch
does not affect the rendered release notes, but updating URLs to the
latest would help avoiding mechanical patches of updating links :)

Change-Id: I2aec3adeb400323d42a3a5083f8bc0798eeff917
'}]
commit_message:
Update the doc links to the newest ones

The docstring of getExtensions service in cinder.service.js
was a copy from nova service and not correct. The docstring was
updated based on the current cinder v2 API.

Thanks to a recent improvement in reno, touching release notes
in older releases in the master branch no longer polute the rendered
release notes. Changing URLs (or other things) in the master branch
does not affect the rendered release notes, but updating URLs to the
latest would help avoiding mechanical patches of updating links :)

Change-Id: I2aec3adeb400323d42a3a5083f8bc0798eeff917

commit_message:
Split pxe drivers

To not load all pxe drivers on import, split them in different files, so
that we only load the necessary modules depending on configuration.

Change-Id: I4c03baaa5c3158f92382666cea3a1804bca97e14
Related-Bug: #1738411

commit_message:
Remove Zuul from OpenStack governance

Zuul is becoming a top-level project under the OpenStack Foundation,
so remove it from OpenStack project governance.

Nodepool and the other repos in this change are considered constituent
projects of Zuul.

Change-Id: I28319b621989ad660ae18fdc176462fb840aecc0

commit_message:
Remove ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin

ironic and ironic-inspector both use ironic-tempest-plugin, so
ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin is not needed, nor was it ever used
(the git repo only has a .gitreview file in it).

This removes the ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin project.

This mostly follows the instructions at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550537
Change-Id: I30580f4d05636e3fc980ffefec64097627aea0dd

subject: [CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & internal_api network
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-03-19 15:24:09.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/memcached_hardening-2529734099da27f4.yaml', 'puppet/services/memcached.yaml'], 'message': '[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & internal_api network

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and internal_api network.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8fb81d7f3938b04ff7652e30de35a1ec23ae723d
Related-Bug: #1754607
'}]
commit_message:
[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & internal_api network

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and internal_api network.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8fb81d7f3938b04ff7652e30de35a1ec23ae723d
Related-Bug: #1754607

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-14 08:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/test_exception_base.py'], 'message': 'Add a unit test to check initializers of MistralException hierarcy

* This test checks that all classes derived from MistralException
  have one initializer with only one "message" parameter. It's
  because at some places (rpc/base.py at least) we assume that
  such an initializer exists.

Change-Id: Ieb1cf1510d88553038cd812d87fb7698755406e7
'}]
commit_message:
Add a unit test to check initializers of MistralException hierarcy

* This test checks that all classes derived from MistralException
  have one initializer with only one "message" parameter. It's
  because at some places (rpc/base.py at least) we assume that
  such an initializer exists.

Change-Id: Ieb1cf1510d88553038cd812d87fb7698755406e7

This option will allow you to pass in a configurable list of
directories/files that will be added onto the resulting tar
command with a --exclude option.

This is useful elsewhere in tripleo in that it will allow us to
further prune the growing t-h-t tree a bit to optimize performance a
bit.

Change-Id: I2be733efd199a503d4ccc90a01764576fb5fe78b
'}]
commit_message:
Add excludes option to create_tarball function

This option will allow you to pass in a configurable list of
directories/files that will be added onto the resulting tar
command with a --exclude option.

This is useful elsewhere in tripleo in that it will allow us to
further prune the growing t-h-t tree a bit to optimize performance a
bit.

Change-Id: I2be733efd199a503d4ccc90a01764576fb5fe78b

commit_message:
consolidate tq configurations

There are several configurations that are no longer
very well tested due to limitation in ci.centos.
Consolidating on configurations that are tested in upstream
and rdo.

The patch rebases minimal and pacemaker configs to be
exactly like fs001 w/ single-nic-vlans instead of
multiple nics

Related-Bug: #1737602
Change-Id: Id26eb558800b8fccc5e5f2c2f9684545e445bc6d

commit_message:
Increase the image size to 23G

The recent tests showed that we need more space for the /var
partition, and that we need to increase the final size of the
image to 23G to fit the needs. And we need to rebalance the
percentage used by volumes to have similar sizes.

Change-Id: Icf25fc15bd71a50e68038012683e3e56aaa72443
Depends-On: I3885a5c359b56c515dbb9286ded1dee062cdcffc

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-01 16:51:56.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6d5cf905767ced1483026dd6b0cf872d200da030
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6d5cf905767ced1483026dd6b0cf872d200da030

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-03-20 06:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/nfvo/drivers/vnffg/sfc_drivers/networking-sfc/test_n_sfc.py', 'tacker/nfvo/drivers/vim/openstack_driver.py', 'tacker/extensions/nfvo.py'], 'message': 'Add reusing feature when creating VNFFG.

Currently, when a VNFFG is created, Tacker also create port-pair,
port-pair-group, port-chain and flow-classifier. There are no
reusing ability in this approach.

This patch will check the port-id of a VNF is using in other VNFFG
or not. If it is used in a VNFFG, the existing port-pair-group will
be added to the new port-chain.

Therefore, we can create 2 VNFFGs that can go through one VNF.

This patch also clean up network resource such as port pair, port
pair group and flow classifier if there are failures.

Change-Id: I8656105041f20b7f0dc653f940dd0dc5db504e49
Closes-Bug: #1746721
'}]
commit_message:
Add reusing feature when creating VNFFG.

Currently, when a VNFFG is created, Tacker also create port-pair,
port-pair-group, port-chain and flow-classifier. There are no
reusing ability in this approach.

This patch will check the port-id of a VNF is using in other VNFFG
or not. If it is used in a VNFFG, the existing port-pair-group will
be added to the new port-chain.

Therefore, we can create 2 VNFFGs that can go through one VNF.

This patch also clean up network resource such as port pair, port
pair group and flow classifier if there are failures.

Change-Id: I8656105041f20b7f0dc653f940dd0dc5db504e49
Closes-Bug: #1746721

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9e2cfe492726a048dbcc707b79b699d9e9f70d29

subject: Pass hieradata for TLS in the internal network for Ceph RGW
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-04 11:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/ceph-rgw.yaml'], 'message': 'Pass hieradata for TLS in the internal network for Ceph RGW

this passes the necessary hieradata to enable TLS in the internal
network for Ceph RGW. It it also added to the default
enable-internal-tls.yaml environment, but note that it will only
generate the certificates if Ceph RGW is enabled at all.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I89adcad66a88562632ac1737d3bda12b7d4148b0
'}]
commit_message:
Pass hieradata for TLS in the internal network for Ceph RGW

this passes the necessary hieradata to enable TLS in the internal
network for Ceph RGW. It it also added to the default
enable-internal-tls.yaml environment, but note that it will only
generate the certificates if Ceph RGW is enabled at all.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I89adcad66a88562632ac1737d3bda12b7d4148b0

commit_message:
Use cacertfile option to get CA certificate

This removes the need to have another manifest and is generic accross
CAs. This option will fetch the CA certificate to the desired location.

Change-Id: Iec3666a2f0d67877069e9f9386c72798c6fe2d78

subject: Make kolla set permissions for haproxy public cert
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-03 11:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/haproxy.yaml'], 'message': 'Make kolla set permissions for haproxy public cert

In cases were we use the local CA (the containerized undercloud), the
certificate is set as root, so we need to tell kolla to explicitly
change the permissions for haproxy.

Change-Id: I929f85375f0a8e794febd3f83b0d364eb7958950
'}]
commit_message:
Make kolla set permissions for haproxy public cert

In cases were we use the local CA (the containerized undercloud), the
certificate is set as root, so we need to tell kolla to explicitly
change the permissions for haproxy.

Change-Id: I929f85375f0a8e794febd3f83b0d364eb7958950

commit_message:
Ensure firewall setup is run before pacemaker

Seems there are cases where the pacemaker setup is ran before the
firewall, which ends up in the cluster not stabilizing. This avoids
that.

Change-Id: Icc8154cca7f12b1671a1c8a6aea4809d1c40b8b4

commit_message:
Add extra tests for featureset0420 (IPSec)

Given that the IPSec feature affects all the networks in the overcloud,
it's worth testing out more functionality from the overcloud services,
as we need to make sure that it's not affected.

Change-Id: Ie08c90538b32834735a6981e935c50158303a405

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-09 14:04:45.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp'], 'message': 'Enable usage of memcached for keystone

memcached was unconfigured for keystone until now. This should help
boost performance by caching keystone tokens. Security options will come
in a subsequent commit.

Change-Id: I162e904db4efba48f7051fdd4422d4070e957cef

commit_message:
Enable usage of memcached for keystone

memcached was unconfigured for keystone until now. This should help
boost performance by caching keystone tokens. Security options will come
in a subsequent commit.

Change-Id: I162e904db4efba48f7051fdd4422d4070e957cef

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

subject: Ensure reverting test env if the env is temporarily changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-23 07:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': 'Ensure reverting test env if the env is temporarily changed

test_tempurl_keys_hidden_from_acl_readonly changes test env parameter
temporarily for container HEAD. After that the test reverts the change.
But if the HEAD failed with exception, the change is not reverted.
With the non reverted change, some other tests fails even if the test
have no problems.

This patch ensures the reversion by using try-finally.

Change-Id: I8cd7928da6211e5516992fe9f2bc8e568bcab443
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure reverting test env if the env is temporarily changed

test_tempurl_keys_hidden_from_acl_readonly changes test env parameter
temporarily for container HEAD. After that the test reverts the change.
But if the HEAD failed with exception, the change is not reverted.
With the non reverted change, some other tests fails even if the test
have no problems.

This patch ensures the reversion by using try-finally.

Change-Id: I8cd7928da6211e5516992fe9f2bc8e568bcab443

which caused designate to crash when it tried access cached hookenv

commit_message:
Rebuild charm to get charm-helpers 0.18.7

This is to fix a regression introduced in charm-helpers 0.18.6
which caused designate to crash when it tried access cached hookenv
config in charms.openstack ConfigurationAdapter class

commit_message:
Fix layout of dialogs for Angularized users panel

The text inputs on creation dialog for Angularized users panel
is too wide. The dialogs should be rearranged with proper size of
each property.
This patch fixes layout of dialogs for user action dialogs.
Also, add release notes for Angularized users panel.

Change-Id: I68254b50fa3db4e8bb115e8e5e467d166badcb6a
Partial-Implements: blueprint ng-users

commit_message:
Make size of Angular modal form specifiable

The size of Angularized modal form on Horizon is not specifiable.
So create/edit action on Angular Role panel is too wide.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I5bd692e7e858814095e02d1c34d5f83e70d03f0f
Closes-Bug: #1743230

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-14 10:27:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Fix rabbitmq haproxy configuration

While rabbitmq currently does not use haproxy at all, the code for
it inside haproxy is currently wrong.
Let's get this right in case we ever want to put rabbitmq back under
haproxy's balancing

Change-Id: Iaf1f818bdbde000ea3eedf0fb6503f60b3dddf75
Closes-Bug: #1672356
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq haproxy configuration

While rabbitmq currently does not use haproxy at all, the code for
it inside haproxy is currently wrong.
Let's get this right in case we ever want to put rabbitmq back under
haproxy's balancing

Change-Id: Iaf1f818bdbde000ea3eedf0fb6503f60b3dddf75
Closes-Bug: #1672356

subject: Pin puppet-collectd
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-19 16:19:40.000000000', 'files': ['Puppetfile_extras'], 'message': 'Pin puppet-collectd

puppet-collectd introduced a change which requires stdlib 4.25:
de0a96e86651 - (2018-03-17 00:12:21 +0100) feat: bump minimum puppetlabs/stdlib version to 4.25.0
c0c5ba9357ea - (2018-03-16 23:54:58 +0100) feat: use Stdlib::Fqdn type for package_keyserver

Let's pin the repo to the change which is already being used in RDO at
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/master/rdo.yml#L1467

(aka 93c8d0bd32bb5610652f30e785ba6644fc82a8b6 "Merge pull request #751 from bastelfreak/test")

Closes-Bug: #1756890
Change-Id: I197e8036a4f5c790a833d037d03ba6822f5488eb
'}]
commit_message:
Pin puppet-collectd

puppet-collectd introduced a change which requires stdlib 4.25:
de0a96e86651 - (2018-03-17 00:12:21 +0100) feat: bump minimum puppetlabs/stdlib version to 4.25.0
c0c5ba9357ea - (2018-03-16 23:54:58 +0100) feat: use Stdlib::Fqdn type for package_keyserver

Let's pin the repo to the change which is already being used in RDO at
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/master/rdo.yml#L1467

(aka 93c8d0bd32bb5610652f30e785ba6644fc82a8b6 "Merge pull request #751 from bastelfreak/test")

Closes-Bug: #1756890
Change-Id: I197e8036a4f5c790a833d037d03ba6822f5488eb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-19 13:17:39.000000000', 'files': ['config/general_config/featureset020.yml'], 'message': "fs020: deploy containerized overcloud after Pike

Containerized deployments are the default in Queens,
let's reflect that in our testing and switch ovb-ha
job into containers.
This also fixes wrongly usage of tripleomaster namespace
in queens promotion jobs.

Change-Id: Ib82f167a4649089a0941ad101446af3eea79dde6
"}]
commit_message:
fs020: deploy containerized overcloud after Pike

Containerized deployments are the default in Queens,
let's reflect that in our testing and switch ovb-ha
job into containers.
This also fixes wrongly usage of tripleomaster namespace
in queens promotion jobs.

Change-Id: Ib82f167a4649089a0941ad101446af3eea79dde6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-13 14:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_redis_manager.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': 'Fix os.path.join() for unittests under python 3.6

Some unittest cases of trove.tests.unittests.guestagent has mocked
os.path.expanduser(), the result of the mocked function is passed to
os.path.join(). This causes these tests failed under Python3.6 by
TypeError, because a str, bytes or os.PathLike object is expected, but a
MagicMock object is passed in instead. Giving a string return value for
the mocked os.path.expanduser() fixes.

Partial-Bug: #1755417

Change-Id: Ieeb7964a65ceb6fab0f20a0c8fefbe38dd25cb10
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix os.path.join() for unittests under python 3.6

Some unittest cases of trove.tests.unittests.guestagent has mocked
os.path.expanduser(), the result of the mocked function is passed to
os.path.join(). This causes these tests failed under Python3.6 by
TypeError, because a str, bytes or os.PathLike object is expected, but a
MagicMock object is passed in instead. Giving a string return value for
the mocked os.path.expanduser() fixes.

Partial-Bug: #1755417

Change-Id: Ieeb7964a65ceb6fab0f20a0c8fefbe38dd25cb10
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Fix Gate] Fix network segments policy test raising 503

This is to fix the gate by resolving an issue with a Neutron
segments policy test class that hardcodes the network segment
to use gre network type, which may not be supported by the
underlying network, resulting in a 503 exception being raised.
Example stacktrace: [0] and root cause: [1].

Also renames the class and file to convey that actual policy
being tested.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/20/547820/7/check/patrole-admin/5f4e495/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-12_20_50_15_600175
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/20/547820/7/check/patrole-admin/5f4e495/controller/logs/screen-neutron-api.txt.gz#_Mar_12_20_50_15_698713

Change-Id: I6e3daef766f0ed5fabcc125f39471d089c9d7218

commit_message:
Add support for unmanaging snapshot of rbd driver

When introducing managing existing snapshot to rbd driver, I think
it should inherit from ManageableSnapshotsVD.
On the other hand, I did one of the simplest implementations like
unmanage volume.

Change-Id: I61f2a63ac559be71f293fca685fd12bdac6bd032

subject: Pass existing ranges to ContainerBroker._find_shard_ranges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-19 18:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Pass existing ranges to ContainerBroker._find_shard_ranges

The current interface makes it impossible to use _find_shard_ranges to
repeat a scan for shard ranges when existing ranges have been
found. That is unhelpful when writing a tool to manually find new
ranges and possibly replace existing ranges.

This patch changes the method to have any existing ranges optionally
passed in rather than always being read from the db.

Change-Id: I54554392491066eb27f23c274f69daebf6e90706
'}]
commit_message:
Pass existing ranges to ContainerBroker._find_shard_ranges

The current interface makes it impossible to use _find_shard_ranges to
repeat a scan for shard ranges when existing ranges have been
found. That is unhelpful when writing a tool to manually find new
ranges and possibly replace existing ranges.

This patch changes the method to have any existing ranges optionally
passed in rather than always being read from the db.

Change-Id: I54554392491066eb27f23c274f69daebf6e90706

commit_message:
remove tag and tag_ext extensions

The tag and tag_ext extensions are deprecated for removal, but are not
used widely today [1]. Rather than rehoming these extensions to
neutron-lib and carrying out their deprecation life-cycle for no
apparent reason, this patch proposes we just remove them now.

While [2] initially removed these extensions, we had to revert
them with [3].

Depends-On: I295a5b84eb7fa3439561fa009b7499f94d8df4d2

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.extensions%20import%20(tag_ext%7Ctag)
[2] I0d7bcd789b468b1dd3f7ea13e6751a46203d6778
[3] If16443616eee703b66d57b6422dd451a443fbc64

Change-Id: I97095453610fff114d999a526d67e78119546ff5

Change-Id: Iafced231791c75ee59df0a547dea3b1731b9a843

commit_message:
container replicator _in_sync should consider deleted shard ranges

It's already a very blunt tool but it should be blunter. Containers
with any shard ranges, even deleted ones, need to be sync'd every
time.

Change-Id: Iafced231791c75ee59df0a547dea3b1731b9a843

subject: Support -d <devs> and -p <partitions> in DB replicators.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-06 00:26:27.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-container-replicator', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'bin/swift-account-replicator'], 'message': 'Support -d <devs> and -p <partitions> in DB replicators.

Similar to the object replicator and reconstructor, these arguments
are comma-separated lists of device names and partitions,
respectively, on which the account or container replicator will
operate. Other devices and partitions are ignored.

Change-Id: Ic108f5c38f700ac4c7bcf8315bf4c55306951361
'}]
commit_message:
Support -d <devs> and -p <partitions> in DB replicators.

Similar to the object replicator and reconstructor, these arguments
are comma-separated lists of device names and partitions,
respectively, on which the account or container replicator will
operate. Other devices and partitions are ignored.

Change-Id: Ic108f5c38f700ac4c7bcf8315bf4c55306951361

commit_message:
Use -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard

Use the -horizon template instead of explicitly declaring requirements
of Horizon. This is also making the py35 jobs voting which aligns with
the long-term OpenStack-wide goal of Python 3 supporting.

Change-Id: Ia3088386b35ec44f7336239234505fadbf4947ef
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add floating ip connectivity check to common dir and use it for FFU

This change adds the floating IP connectivity check scripts to the
common directory and adjusts existing update and upgrade to use the
new location. In addition it runs the connectivity check scripts
before and after the FFU overcloud upgrade stages.

Change-Id: I8c2fe2ad88c8388a673a4b6c415f6a76bebfd72d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-06 15:48:37.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/network/multiple-nics/network-isolation.yaml', 'ci/environments/network/public-bond/network-isolation.yaml', 'ci/environments/network/multiple-nics-ipv6/network-isolation.yaml'], 'message': "Fix network-isolation.yaml relative paths for ci

These relative paths were incorrect given where these environment files
live in the templates directory tree.

These environment files aren't actually used by ci as their equivalent
network-isolation-absolute.yaml versions are preferred. However, if we
fix these paths we could consider switching ci over to use these as it's
arguable more preferrable instead of the hardcoded packaged path.

Change-Id: Ib0e4779c4883776e25bf7eb5aee60a91ce28a73d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network-isolation.yaml relative paths for ci

These relative paths were incorrect given where these environment files
live in the templates directory tree.

These environment files aren't actually used by ci as their equivalent
network-isolation-absolute.yaml versions are preferred. However, if we
fix these paths we could consider switching ci over to use these as it's
arguable more preferrable instead of the hardcoded packaged path.

Change-Id: Ib0e4779c4883776e25bf7eb5aee60a91ce28a73d

hijack glance-api service with glance-registry removal. For the
removal of glance-registry we reintroduce the disabled service
to Controller role.

Change-Id: I38ab5a91b541e7e070f188ee73ef4c7dd7f65eaa
(cherry picked from commit 9765f8d22564ac988fb07aa84e855e4c84788475)

commit_message:
FFU: Fix glance tasks

We need to register fact instead of reruning checks and we can't
hijack glance-api service with glance-registry removal. For the
removal of glance-registry we reintroduce the disabled service
to Controller role.

Change-Id: I38ab5a91b541e7e070f188ee73ef4c7dd7f65eaa
(cherry picked from commit 9765f8d22564ac988fb07aa84e855e4c84788475)

commit_message:
Add floating IP QoS test cases

This patch adds test cases for neutron bp/floating-ip-rate-limit.
We will create a server with one floating IP. And attach qos
bandwidth rules to the floating IP. Then try to download data
from the server to calculate the bandwidth whether is under
the qos limit.

Depends-On: Ibef48e7842a276fe77c901403d67760871f2b7e0
Partially-Implements blueprint: floating-ip-rate-limit

Change-Id: I50d1775cd1f86201bd21d24650f2c52f316ef1b8

subject: Extract local CA if it expired
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-19 08:59:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/certmonger/ca/local.pp', 'spec/classes/tripleo_certmonger_ca_local_spec.rb'], 'message': "Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)

commit_message:
Set max_microversion 2.42 for hosts tests

The compute os-hosts API is deprecated as of the 2.43 microversion,
so we should set max_microversion = '2.42' for hosts tests.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-19 18:47:02.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/versionutils.py'], 'message': 'Prevent deprecation error messages from pkg_resources

Currently pkg_resources is creating this warning message:

    RuntimeWarning: You have iterated over the result of
    pkg_resources.parse_version. This is a legacy behavior which is
    inconsistent with the new version class introduced in setuptools
    8.0.  In most cases, conversion to a tuple is unnecessary. For
    comparison of versions, sort the Version instances directly. If
    you have another use case requiring the tuple, please file a bug
    with the setuptools project describing that need.

Get the major_version directly from the version string passed in
instead so that the warning message is not raised.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/554318/

Closes-Bug: #1706394
Change-Id: I663ed579c27e48a34fdd9565037110a43e5b5587
(cherry picked from commit 47b22208eaa6be2c0352514a66926dd2baeaa025)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent deprecation error messages from pkg_resources

Currently pkg_resources is creating this warning message:

    RuntimeWarning: You have iterated over the result of
    pkg_resources.parse_version. This is a legacy behavior which is
    inconsistent with the new version class introduced in setuptools
    8.0.  In most cases, conversion to a tuple is unnecessary. For
    comparison of versions, sort the Version instances directly. If
    you have another use case requiring the tuple, please file a bug
    with the setuptools project describing that need.

Get the major_version directly from the version string passed in
instead so that the warning message is not raised.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/554318/

Closes-Bug: #1706394
Change-Id: I663ed579c27e48a34fdd9565037110a43e5b5587
(cherry picked from commit 47b22208eaa6be2c0352514a66926dd2baeaa025)

commit_message:
Add the option to only aggregate hosts that are known by openstack to be active

Adding a parameter to the nova_aggregate type to only add hosts to a host
aggregate that are known by openstack to be active and corresponding handling
of said parameter to the nova_aggregate/openstack provider.

commit_message:
Disallow TLS v1.0 from HAProxy

This forces HAProxy to only accept newer versions of TLS, which allows
us to meet FedRAMP requirements.

Change-Id: I14f4de3875a743ee5328b13668790b26cefd8439
Related-Bug: #1754368
(cherry picked from commit ebde918b0f0cea8715a30f57ca7c2683dd477c50)

Also changed the argument order to be more like the
other methods in the module, which is Ok since the
only consumer is in the file itself.

Trivialfix

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-01-30 10:28:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': "Ensure emulator threads are always calculated

In change 'I071182c00a0', the '_get_pinning' inner function of
'nova.virt.hardware._pack_instance_onto_cores' was extended to calculate
emulator thread pinning information along with guest vCPU pinning
information. Unfortunately, there is a code path used for calculating
vCPU pinning information in '_pack_instance_onto_cores' which does not
use this function and emulator thread pinning was therefore not being
calculated in some cases.

Replace this code path with a call to '_get_pinning', ensuring that all
permutations follow a similar flow and that the emulator thread pinning
information is calculated, as expected.

We also add a log which appears to have been missed in the
aforementioned change.

Change-Id: I021ce59048d6292055af49457ba642022f648c81
Closes-Bug: #1744965
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure emulator threads are always calculated

In change 'I071182c00a0', the '_get_pinning' inner function of
'nova.virt.hardware._pack_instance_onto_cores' was extended to calculate
emulator thread pinning information along with guest vCPU pinning
information. Unfortunately, there is a code path used for calculating
vCPU pinning information in '_pack_instance_onto_cores' which does not
use this function and emulator thread pinning was therefore not being
calculated in some cases.

Replace this code path with a call to '_get_pinning', ensuring that all
permutations follow a similar flow and that the emulator thread pinning
information is calculated, as expected.

We also add a log which appears to have been missed in the
aforementioned change.

Change-Id: I021ce59048d6292055af49457ba642022f648c81
Closes-Bug: #1744965

subject: Fix watch loops to handle compaction
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-03-19 17:04:27.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/test_plugin_etcd.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/status.py', 'networking_calico/etcdv3.py', 'networking_calico/tests/test_etcdutils.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/election.py', 'networking_calico/tests/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'networking_calico/etcdutils.py'], 'message': "Fix watch loops to handle compaction

The etcdutils watcher loop did not respond properly to etcd compaction.
It had an inner loop and an outer loop, and when compaction occurs we
needed to break to the outer loop - so that we reread the current DB
revision - but in fact we only continued in the inner loop, which meant
that we kept restarting an incorrect watch from a revision that no
longer exists.

etcd3gw as it stands cannot distinguish between two watch timeout cases:

1. watch timeout because of genuine inactivity

2. watch timeout because the revision that we asked to start watching
from no longer exists.

However, we could eliminate (1) as a possibility by regularly writing
ourselves into the tree that is being watched; that acts as an elegant
test of round-trip connectivity to the etcd cluster.

Then, if the watch ever times out, it must be because of compaction (2)
or a genuine connectivity problem.  We should handle that by rereading
the current revision - which means breaking to the outer loop.  And then
it turns out that we don't need the inner loop any more at all.

For the status watching in the Neutron driver, that's what we do.  For
the endpoint and subnet watching in the DHCP agent, we let the watch
timeout and then reread the relevant trees, because that is better than
having every compute host write 2 etcd keys every 3 seconds.

Also in this commit:

- Empirically, the election watcher loop already handled compaction
  correctly, but I've reviewed it to understand and document why that
  is, and reduced the timeout for the unlikely windows where compaction
  causes a watch to time out instead of delivering the next election key
  event.

- When we reread the complete status tree, we could generate Felix agent
  status updates to the Neutron DB that are duplicates of previous
  updates.  We already had code to avoid that for port statuses; this
  commit adds deduplication for agent status as well.

- Another example of unnecessary watch-triggered 'duplication' is the
  DHCP agent restarting Dnsmasq when the set of ports that we want it to
  handle, for each Neutron network, is not actually changing at all.
  This commit enhances the code to avoid that.

Change-Id: I48c863388d1a6f54ebcd587dc2944d1b5f585638
"}]
commit_message:
Fix watch loops to handle compaction

The etcdutils watcher loop did not respond properly to etcd compaction.
It had an inner loop and an outer loop, and when compaction occurs we
needed to break to the outer loop - so that we reread the current DB
revision - but in fact we only continued in the inner loop, which meant
that we kept restarting an incorrect watch from a revision that no
longer exists.

etcd3gw as it stands cannot distinguish between two watch timeout cases:

1. watch timeout because of genuine inactivity

2. watch timeout because the revision that we asked to start watching
from no longer exists.

However, we could eliminate (1) as a possibility by regularly writing
ourselves into the tree that is being watched; that acts as an elegant
test of round-trip connectivity to the etcd cluster.

Then, if the watch ever times out, it must be because of compaction (2)
or a genuine connectivity problem.  We should handle that by rereading
the current revision - which means breaking to the outer loop.  And then
it turns out that we don't need the inner loop any more at all.

For the status watching in the Neutron driver, that's what we do.  For
the endpoint and subnet watching in the DHCP agent, we let the watch
timeout and then reread the relevant trees, because that is better than
having every compute host write 2 etcd keys every 3 seconds.

Also in this commit:

- Empirically, the election watcher loop already handled compaction
  correctly, but I've reviewed it to understand and document why that
  is, and reduced the timeout for the unlikely windows where compaction
  causes a watch to time out instead of delivering the next election key
  event.

- When we reread the complete status tree, we could generate Felix agent
  status updates to the Neutron DB that are duplicates of previous
  updates.  We already had code to avoid that for port statuses; this
  commit adds deduplication for agent status as well.

- Another example of unnecessary watch-triggered 'duplication' is the
  DHCP agent restarting Dnsmasq when the set of ports that we want it to
  handle, for each Neutron network, is not actually changing at all.
  This commit enhances the code to avoid that.

Change-Id: I48c863388d1a6f54ebcd587dc2944d1b5f585638

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-01-30 10:28:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_claims.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/objects/numa.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_numa.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Don't filter out sibling sets with one core

libvirt collects and exposes information about the host just as it does
for guests. This information includes things like the host CPU topology.
Nova uses this information to, among other things, generate an instance
of 'nova.objects.numa.NUMACell' for each host NUMA cell. The 'siblings'
field for each of these objects is populated using a combination of the
siblings information exposed by libvirt minus the cores we've been told
not to use, via the nova-specific 'vcpu_pin_set' option.

On pretty much any standard (x86) machine, it would be exceedingly
unlikely to find an asymmetric topology like so:

  socket 0
    core 0
      thread 0  (CPU #0)
      thread 1  (CPU #2)
    core 1
      thread 0  (CPU #1)

(note the missing 'CPU 3').

However these do happen in nova's world and are perfectly valid, thanks
to the aforementioned 'vcpu_pin_set' option. Historically, once we've
generated this list of sibling sets needed for the 'siblings' field,
we've filtered out sets that contain less than two siblings (i.e. the
cores have no siblings, or CPU #1 in the above example). This would be a
fair assumption on normal hardware, where asymmetric topologies like the
above wouldn't exist, but it doesn't really make sense in this use case.
What we're trying to expose via the siblings attribute is the
relationships between cores: if no relationship exists, we should say as
much.

The code that populates the 'siblings' attribute is modified to no
longer exclude sibling sets with only one sibling. This allows us to
simplify code that was previously having to switch between the
'siblings' attribute and the flat 'cpuset' attribute. In addition, all
tests that use the 'NUMACell' object are updated to set the 'sibling'
attribute as it is now always set in "real" code. This ensures behavior
hasn't regressed.

Change-Id: I8982ab25338969cd98621f79b7fbec8af43d12c5
Partial-Bug: #1744965
'}]
commit_message:
Don't filter out sibling sets with one core

libvirt collects and exposes information about the host just as it does
for guests. This information includes things like the host CPU topology.
Nova uses this information to, among other things, generate an instance
of 'nova.objects.numa.NUMACell' for each host NUMA cell. The 'siblings'
field for each of these objects is populated using a combination of the
siblings information exposed by libvirt minus the cores we've been told
not to use, via the nova-specific 'vcpu_pin_set' option.

On pretty much any standard (x86) machine, it would be exceedingly
unlikely to find an asymmetric topology like so:

  socket 0
    core 0
      thread 0  (CPU #0)
      thread 1  (CPU #2)
    core 1
      thread 0  (CPU #1)

(note the missing 'CPU 3').

However these do happen in nova's world and are perfectly valid, thanks
to the aforementioned 'vcpu_pin_set' option. Historically, once we've
generated this list of sibling sets needed for the 'siblings' field,
we've filtered out sets that contain less than two siblings (i.e. the
cores have no siblings, or CPU #1 in the above example). This would be a
fair assumption on normal hardware, where asymmetric topologies like the
above wouldn't exist, but it doesn't really make sense in this use case.
What we're trying to expose via the siblings attribute is the
relationships between cores: if no relationship exists, we should say as
much.

The code that populates the 'siblings' attribute is modified to no
longer exclude sibling sets with only one sibling. This allows us to
simplify code that was previously having to switch between the
'siblings' attribute and the flat 'cpuset' attribute. In addition, all
tests that use the 'NUMACell' object are updated to set the 'sibling'
attribute as it is now always set in "real" code. This ensures behavior
hasn't regressed.

Change-Id: I8982ab25338969cd98621f79b7fbec8af43d12c5
Partial-Bug: #1744965

commit_message:
Rename _get_shard_ranges to _fetch_shard_ranges

It was confusing to have broker.get_shard_ranges() and
sharder._get_shard_ranges() which do very different things.

Also rename _update_shard_ranges() to _send_shard_ranges() to remove
confusion with ShardRange.update_* methods.

Also move the send related methods to be adjacent to the fetch method.

Change-Id: I1525144d7d6413ee6effda1c2620ed923a40b291

commit_message:
Add max_microversion for hosts client/security group clients

The following clients:
  * hosts_client (2.43)
  * security_groups_client (2.36)
  * security_group_default_rules_client (2.36)
  * security_group_rules_client (2.36)

are all deprecated as of the (microversion).

This patch updates the max_microversion for all tests
that use these clients.

This patch also replaces usage of hosts_client to list host
names with comparable endpoint in hypervisor_client to do
the same in tests that do not directly test the hosts_client
(like testing live migrations). This is because nova docs say:
"To list and show host details, use the Hypervisors
(os-hypervisors) API" [0].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#hosts-os-hosts-deprecated

Change-Id: I2c85be6eaf2a99d977011e049bcffd0f18a4e615

commit_message:
Extra domain config assertions for default-only group

This patch makes 2 changes:
  - Changes docstrings for references to API docs for domain
    config client as mentioned in this review [0].
  - Adds additional assertions to the domain config API tests
    to check that the "security_compliance" group is properly
    formatted.

Note that the "security_compliance" group is only available
to the default domain [1] and currently only supports 2
options: "password_regex" and "password_regex_description" [2].
Also note that this endpoint enforces a different policy action
"get_security_compliance_domain_config" [3] and while it
is "free-for-all" by default, "get_domain_config" is first
enforced [4], which is admin-only by default.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452949/4/tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/domain_configuration_client.py
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/core.py#L1145
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/core.py#L1152
[3] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/domain_config.py
[4] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/controllers.py

Change-Id: I2ea5ade975be4feb31285c0e3d35f075e1a5fb6c

subject: Bring vexxhost back online for testing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-19 19:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nl03.openstack.org.yaml'], 'message': "Bring vexxhost back online for testing

We created a new mirror in vexxhost with no bandwidth limits, the
thought here is this should results in better job run times as our
mirror will not be the bottleneck.

We've also changed flavors to use v2-highcpu-8 which are 8C/8Gb
memory, but require us to now boot-from-volume with 80GB volume-size.

Change-Id: Ibb26597cfd3c3b10891d7a60e70c6143d1c12407
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Bring vexxhost back online for testing

We created a new mirror in vexxhost with no bandwidth limits, the
thought here is this should results in better job run times as our
mirror will not be the bottleneck.

We've also changed flavors to use v2-highcpu-8 which are 8C/8Gb
memory, but require us to now boot-from-volume with 80GB volume-size.

Change-Id: Ibb26597cfd3c3b10891d7a60e70c6143d1c12407
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Temporarily make legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src NV

Stable/pike is currently broken due to a change in pip [0] and
a change in setuptools [1]. Each change is needed to land to fix
things, but they are in different repos, so there is no way to
combine the changes into one to get it through.

This patch makes the failing job for one non-voting to get that
in, to allow getting in the other one, at which point this one
will be reverted.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554270/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554053/

Change-Id: I9c46fb9af99bc1960cee513e0cf383f751b0126b

During the Rocky PTG, it was decided that services should have some
sort of library to help with quota enforcement based on limits stored
in keystone. This relationship is very similar to how services
enforce policy decisions based on role assignments in keystone using
the oslo.policy library.

This commit creates a new oslo library called oslo.limit to fill this

Needed-By: I46d5d16f29a4a613c96f01023c89e94b39abf2dd

commit_message:
Create new project for oslo.limit

During the Rocky PTG, it was decided that services should have some
sort of library to help with quota enforcement based on limits stored
in keystone. This relationship is very similar to how services
enforce policy decisions based on role assignments in keystone using
the oslo.policy library.

This commit creates a new oslo library called oslo.limit to fill this
need.

Needed-By: I46d5d16f29a4a613c96f01023c89e94b39abf2dd

commit_message:
Update placement aggregates spec to clarify generation handling

This adds a paragraph to the placement-aggregate-generation spec to
clarify that in older microversions, the generation of the resource
provider will not be updated. We considered updating it whatever the
microversion but it turns out that there's extant code relying on
the old behavior.

blueprint placement-aggregate-generation

Change-Id: I41e06d4bddf2ad5d12de99d19118ded96159cdd2
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Abstract away the virtualization management interface

This change decouples the virtualization drivers (presently
just libvirt) from the Redfish REST API server. The
goal is to be able to support multiple virtualization
backends in parallel by way of running dedicated and
unified drivers. Most immediate candidate would be
novaclient (e.g. OpenStack API).

The change has two parts to it:

* introduced an abstract base class for the virtualization
  driver
* introduced the libvirt driver based on the existing
  libvirt code refactored into to the abstract driver
  framework
* implemented Redfish-compliant error reporting

There should be no change in functionality of the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: Ic4df2fc2986e7077afb1f937754f0f20b4f8ed3a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-01 22:08:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_groups.py'], 'message': 'Make GroupsV3TestJSON v2 compatible

This patch aims to replace the domain created for testing by the
domain used when getting v3 credentials. This is the name keystone
uses for v2 compatibility.

During group or user creation, the lookup of the domain will cause
a 404 to be returned because v3 created domains are not visible to
the v2 domain.

By using the default_credentials_domain_name option, it allows users
of domain_specific_drivers config option to specify the domain name
that was used for their pre-provisioned credentials.

Change-Id: I136b28f90280857ae8e9b0e968e67445e2cce44d
'}]
commit_message:
Make GroupsV3TestJSON v2 compatible

This patch aims to replace the domain created for testing by the
domain used when getting v3 credentials. This is the name keystone
uses for v2 compatibility.

During group or user creation, the lookup of the domain will cause
a 404 to be returned because v3 created domains are not visible to
the v2 domain.

By using the default_credentials_domain_name option, it allows users
of domain_specific_drivers config option to specify the domain name
that was used for their pre-provisioned credentials.

Change-Id: I136b28f90280857ae8e9b0e968e67445e2cce44d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-19 03:45:50.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/containers-lxc-create.yml'], 'message': 'Do not collect physical host facts in playbook

The role itself depends on physical host facts being collected,
but the collection occurring in the playbook does not accommodate
--limit containername, it will require
--limit containername:physicalhost in order for the required facts
to be collected.

To allow limit to target only the containers being created, the
fact collection has been moved to the role and the module is
executed against the physical_host using delegation.

Change-Id: Idc0ae7913b3ea9374caa41a207fab8c72f42bf41
'}]
commit_message:
Do not collect physical host facts in playbook

The role itself depends on physical host facts being collected,
but the collection occurring in the playbook does not accommodate
--limit containername, it will require
--limit containername:physicalhost in order for the required facts
to be collected.

To allow limit to target only the containers being created, the
fact collection has been moved to the role and the module is
executed against the physical_host using delegation.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554105/
Change-Id: Idc0ae7913b3ea9374caa41a207fab8c72f42bf41

commit_message:
Correct is_container when deploying containers

The is_container option was not be set or correctly interpreted. This
change sets the option when the openstack_host role is run on
containers.

Example host specific tasks running on containers unnecessarily:
  http://logs.openstack.org/36/553636/2/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/3805c3f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-16_02_31_02_897102

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0595e23ff7fa612666fa971312dfcfe719e002ce)

commit_message:
Import systemd_mount and systemd_service to OSA

This patch adds the generic roles systemd_mount,
systemd_networkd, and systemd_service,
manipulating systemd units.

This is for DRY purposes.

An individual core group is added, but the general OSA
core group would have core capabilities as a back-stop
for now, until more diversity is found.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552866/
Change-Id: Ic139198d4ef3fdd9c6d1ba3555e6e94a20b613bc

commit_message:
Optimize tasks for the container backend if defined

When the machinectl backend is in service there's no need to create a
tarball of the container rootfs. This change sets a fact for the backend
store and skips tasks that are unnecessary when using machinectl.

Change-Id: Ie759ae486157a31523b261041eb66bbb20f80e5a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-16 16:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['action/config_template.py', 'tests/test-config_template.yml'], 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
"}]
commit_message:
Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 15205, 'name': 'Guillaume Abrioux', 'email': 'gabrioux@redhat.com'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-08 10:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/advanced_deployment/tls_everywhere.rst'], 'message': 'Deprecate use of mon_use_fqdn from tls_everywhere docs

This was useful to workaround a bug in ceph-ansible fixed by [1].

Those deployments previously enabling use of fqdn to set the
mon instance names will continue to work as long as the boolean
is passed on upgrades.

1. https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/bdcc52b96dc1f9c99ce490117170f644623d4846

commit_message:
Deprecate use of mon_use_fqdn from tls_everywhere docs

This was useful to workaround a bug in ceph-ansible fixed by [1].

Those deployments previously enabling use of fqdn to set the
mon instance names will continue to work as long as the boolean
is passed on upgrades.

1. https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/bdcc52b96dc1f9c99ce490117170f644623d4846

Change-Id: Ibf2bc50aa2ac63935ebe806d9ff3b26f64969ec6
Closes-Bug: 1752913

commit_message:
Update contributor/placement.rst to contemporary reality

This udpates the placement contributor documentation to reflect the
current state of affairs. Ininitially this was just going to be an
update to reflect that the oslo versioned objects had moved. However,
while reviewing the rest of the doc it became clear there were other
issues that should be resolved. Doing so in one shot helps to maintain
the continuity of the document and doing it piecemeal means it is less
likely to happen.

Change-Id: Ia8d4861799e27a30108dd465d15828c5a1943819

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-08 19:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Conflict adding cinder type (lvmdriver-1)

In a multinode environment, c-vol should be enabled on the second node
which triggers volume type creation (as per documentation). When running
stack.sh on the second node,an error is reported cinder is trying to
create a volume type that already exists.

In this fix, check to see if the volume type exists before creating it.

Closes-Bug: #1390028

Signed-off-by: Amy Fong <amy.fong@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Conflict adding cinder type (lvmdriver-1)

In a multinode environment, c-vol should be enabled on the second node
which triggers volume type creation (as per documentation). When running
stack.sh on the second node,an error is reported cinder is trying to
create a volume type that already exists.

In this fix, check to see if the volume type exists before creating it.

Closes-Bug: #1390028

Change-Id: Id7ae00456f1be5c1aed9461379a99832f8faf5ed
Signed-off-by: Amy Fong <amy.fong@windriver.com>

The devstack script failed to install openstack when I used ocata devstack on ubuntu 16.04. The reason I found in the stack.sh.log was that it failed to install python-nss.

Should we add libnss3-dev in the files/debs/general?

commit_message:
add libnss3-dev

The devstack script failed to install openstack when I used ocata devstack on ubuntu 16.04. The reason I found in the stack.sh.log was that it failed to install python-nss.

Should we add libnss3-dev in the files/debs/general?

Change-Id: I5af45b7d3034215d1accda1e061f11024f51347f

Do not assume that Devstack is always in its directory as devstack
plugins may change that, resulting in a broken gate.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-02 00:52:38.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Add fixed_key in cinder.conf

When Cinder creates an encrypted volume from image, it accesses
the key manager to get the key, encryptes the image data, and writes to
volume. This feature is introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216567/.

By default, it uses ConfKeyManager. The key manager needs
the parameter fixed_key set in config file. This key manager is just
for test, not for customer usage.

Change-Id: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6
'}]
commit_message:
Add fixed_key in cinder.conf

When Cinder creates an encrypted volume from image, it accesses
the key manager to get the key, encryptes the image data, and writes to
volume. This feature is introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216567/.

By default, it uses ConfKeyManager. The key manager needs
the parameter fixed_key set in config file. This key manager is just
for test, not for customer usage.

Change-Id: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6

commit_message:
allow specify identity api version via openrc

This patch adds some optional arguments to allow users specify
OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION via openrc script, to let them have a better
life :)

PS: There is no need to append version path in OS_AUTH_URL because we
already set environment variable OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION.

Change-Id: Id2e01daaa182861693d481a34bdb9248f5ca8ead

commit_message:
[demo] admin only endpoint

This run is for demonstrating what would happen if we would
use the keystone admin entry point for both endpoints.

As you (probably) can see, a little extra tweak will be required
to simplify the keystone deployments.

Change-Id: I126d70b4fc6c091fa82cc80a27a54ff4cd687c5c

commit_message:
Replace 'cowsay' by 'dvorak7min' in tests/test_functions.sh

On Ubuntu xenial, run_tests.sh fails because 'cowsay' used for tests of
package operation functions has now dependency.
It's better to replace 'cowsay' by some reasonablly small and stable
package such as 'dvorak7min' rather than changing test logic.

Change-Id: I791b2a67eb84f864b909befd455156a3f4f4294b
Closes-Bug: 1614185
Signed-off-by: Masanori Itoh <masanori.itoh@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make unstack.sh keep Keystone Apache config

rejoin-stack.sh will not recreate symlink
/etc/apache2/sites-enabled/keystone.conf. A better way is not to remove
symlink in unstack.sh.

Change-Id: Ied4a3a600d7df36afe2cf6ebaca4c250a731ab15
Closes-Bug: #1551452

in the DVR router-info to handle FloatingIP's
as mentioned in the reference patch[1], the
dist_fip_count variable was removed and was
replaced by rtr_fip_connect.

So change in variable 'rtr_fip_connect' was
not fixed in FWaaS.

This patch fixes it in the FWaaS to apply
the Firewall rule in the router namespace
for the North-South traffic.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283757

Closes-Bug: #1715395
Change-Id: Id8c902381f95e39bc13e3b3aeeeaa799c72f0dca
"}]
commit_message:
DVR-FWaaS: Fix DVR FWaaS rules for fipnamespace

FWaaS for DVR routers were only supported for
North-South traffic. But with the recent change
in the DVR router-info to handle FloatingIP's
as mentioned in the reference patch[1], the
dist_fip_count variable was removed and was
replaced by rtr_fip_connect.

So change in variable 'rtr_fip_connect' was
not fixed in FWaaS.

This patch fixes it in the FWaaS to apply
the Firewall rule in the router namespace
for the North-South traffic.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283757

Closes-Bug: #1715395
Change-Id: Id8c902381f95e39bc13e3b3aeeeaa799c72f0dca

WIP: simplify the python3 logic

We've got the compute starter kit + cinder running under python3. The
path forward at this point isn't really mixed mode, it's -nv python3
jobs until they get voting by projects, then flip those on.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-31 04:57:11.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'stackrc'], 'message': "Ability to force pre-cache of test images

Add DEVSTACK_NO_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE and equivalent sentinel file to prevent
automatic downloads of test images.  This is for situations where
images should be pre-cached and we wish to ensure we are not hitting
the network to download during test runs (see
Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113)

For OpenStack CI, I23cdeb6757e2a633b634b6db7353acb8122e4745 adds the
sentinel file to cache in the daily image builds.

Note when in use with CI, this is a bit of a chicken-egg problem for
adding new downloads (gate would have to cache them before they are
usable).  Initial testing can easily override this explicitly.  At
commit time, we would need to commit the image update first, allow a
new build of the infra-images and then commit whatever is using the
image (or, just accept the new test is broken until the new daily
image builds with the download in it).  Given the infrequency at which
this occurs and worst-case latency of 24 hours (next image build), I
don't see this being a big issue (also, this is what we've tried to do
manually before when adding images to avoid hitting the network in
runs.  This just enforces it).

Change-Id: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113
"}]
commit_message:
Ability to force pre-cache of test images

Add DEVSTACK_NO_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE and equivalent sentinel file to prevent
automatic downloads of test images.  This is for situations where
images should be pre-cached and we wish to ensure we are not hitting
the network to download during test runs (see
Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113)

For OpenStack CI, I23cdeb6757e2a633b634b6db7353acb8122e4745 adds the
sentinel file to cache in the daily image builds.

Note when in use with CI, this is a bit of a chicken-egg problem for
adding new downloads (gate would have to cache them before they are
usable).  Initial testing can easily override this explicitly.  At
commit time, we would need to commit the image update first, allow a
new build of the infra-images and then commit whatever is using the
image (or, just accept the new test is broken until the new daily
image builds with the download in it).  Given the infrequency at which
this occurs and worst-case latency of 24 hours (next image build), I
don't see this being a big issue (also, this is what we've tried to do
manually before when adding images to avoid hitting the network in
runs.  This just enforces it).

Change-Id: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113

unnecessary images in CI pre-cache situations.

unnecessary images in the openstack CI builds

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-09 19:41:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest', 'stackrc'], 'message': "Differentiate between DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME and filename

The DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME variable is used to reference the name of the
default image in glance after it has been uploaded by devstack. It is
used both inside and outside of devstack for that purpose. However, when
configuring tempest there are some tests which also do image uploads and
need a filename for specifying which file they should upload into glance
for testing purposes. Previously we were just using DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME
for both purposes, but this causes a conflict if the name of the image
we upload into glance does not have a file extension. So instead of
conflating the things this commit differentiates between them and adds a
new DEFAULT_IMAGE_FILE_NAME variable to use for this purpose.

This conflicts because there were several intermediate changes before
this was finished. This just skips to the end state. Additionally the
change id is removed because to get things working in the gate

 Conflicts:
	lib/tempest
	stackrc

Depends-On: Iee7c922cd534ff9ec67cffd2aaa1a03360c1b74a
Change-Id: Ic276cbbb91aaf73ba44e588a607338b93d056da8
"}]
commit_message:
Differentiate between DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME and filename

The DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME variable is used to reference the name of the
default image in glance after it has been uploaded by devstack. It is
used both inside and outside of devstack for that purpose. However, when
configuring tempest there are some tests which also do image uploads and
need a filename for specifying which file they should upload into glance
for testing purposes. Previously we were just using DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME
for both purposes, but this causes a conflict if the name of the image
we upload into glance does not have a file extension. So instead of
conflating the things this commit differentiates between them and adds a
new DEFAULT_IMAGE_FILE_NAME variable to use for this purpose.

This conflicts because there were several intermediate changes before
this was finished. This just skips to the end state. Additionally the
change id is removed because to get things working in the gate
consistently this needs to land in a very specific order. This can't be
done if the change-ids all match.

 Conflicts:
	lib/tempest
	stackrc

(cherry picked from commit befe0925e7cb3d3b34ee9e856c4bc822a499975f)

Depends-On: Iee7c922cd534ff9ec67cffd2aaa1a03360c1b74a
Change-Id: Ic276cbbb91aaf73ba44e588a607338b93d056da8

commit_message:
Add support for pip and git repo names not matching

python-openstacksdk publishes to PyPI as openstacksdk. The previous
patch added a hard-coded work around. This is a stab at a more general
approach to the problem.

Change-Id: I23b9b6fc56bc76e4cb20d98b1a45758d41631c68

The API 'do_group_snapshot_list' in v3/shell.py misses api_version wraps,
and the cmd 'cinder group-snapshot-list' can be used even not specifing
the param 'os-volume-api-version'. This patch just to fix it.

Change-Id: I6a46e587b1aab692fe6b81b46fa3d95ab66c0625

commit_message:
Add api_version wraps for group snapshot list in v3/shell.py

The API 'do_group_snapshot_list' in v3/shell.py misses api_version wraps,
and the cmd 'cinder group-snapshot-list' can be used even not specifing
the param 'os-volume-api-version'. This patch just to fix it.

Change-Id: I6a46e587b1aab692fe6b81b46fa3d95ab66c0625

commit_message:
Keystone service stop after restarting systemd-journald.

To avoid this issue, keystone service service should 'restart' not 'start'.
q-svc and placement-api as well.

Closes-Bug: #1697113
Closes-Bug: #1697124
Change-Id: I5c22902be765dd8cbe1a8e8e1a6e4f569498f723

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-19 12:06:29.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_node/test_overcloud_node.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/workflows/test_baremetal.py'], 'message': "Fail 'node introspect --all-manageable' if no nodes were introspected

Users calling this command tend to assume they have nodes to be
introspected. Currently if no nodes actually are introspected, e.g.
due to maintenance mode or incorrect state, we report success.
This change makes it report failure.

Also changes the success log to include the number of nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1756855
Change-Id: I22e0a525ec8bce265abbbd69ee383e678043649a
"}]
commit_message:
Fail 'node introspect --all-manageable' if no nodes were introspected

Users calling this command tend to assume they have nodes to be
introspected. Currently if no nodes actually are introspected, e.g.
due to maintenance mode or incorrect state, we report success.
This change makes it report failure.

Also changes the success log to include the number of nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1756855
Change-Id: I22e0a525ec8bce265abbbd69ee383e678043649a

commit_message:
Use config opt value to determine import methods

Instead of validating import requests by checking the provided
import-method against a hard-coded list, use the values in the
appropriate configuration option.

Closes-bug: #1754634

commit_message:
Check for `standard-attr-tag` Neutron extension

`tag` and `tag-ext` Neutron extensions are deprecated and scheduled for
removal in Rocky. Those are replaced by `standard-attr-tag` extensions
and this commit implements its support in kuryr-libnetwork.

Change-Id: I295a5b84eb7fa3439561fa009b7499f94d8df4d2
Closes-Bug: 1756305

commit_message:
Add a test class to validate UTs fixes of new_facade flag

In I3a8bc06a671e37959e3014f8672b9a5e118c5c52, we added mocks to
avoid touching databases when switching to new engine facade.
However, currently we do not have test codes to catch those failure.
This patch adds a fake object setting new_facade to True, to validate
without I3a8bc06a671e37959e3014f8672b9a5e118c5c52, the test class
would fail.

Change-Id: I968806b237f9c1275e7624a0995189c1d0bc75fb
Closes-Bug: #1750735

subject: DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-19 14:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/journal/cleanup.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/test_base_db.py'], 'message': 'DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests

Test with: `tox -epy27 test_delete_completed_rows_retries_exceptions`

Two starter questions,

1) First thing is that new enginefacade seems to try to open a new
connection to with each session. This hits the limitation that sqlite
databases cannot be connected twice. Is there something else I should be
doing to avoid this issue?

2) Is the retry decorator needed with enginefacade?

Change-Id: Id561c212f66dc123c8c3ca9685f1f0a654bb310a
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests

Test with: `tox -epy27 test_delete_completed_rows_retries_exceptions`

Two starter questions,

1) First thing is that new enginefacade seems to try to open a new
connection to with each session. This hits the limitation that sqlite
databases cannot be connected twice. Is there something else I should be
doing to avoid this issue?

2) Is the retry decorator needed with enginefacade?

Change-Id: Id561c212f66dc123c8c3ca9685f1f0a654bb310a

commit_message:
Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

By removing the " " this is resolved.

Change-Id: I1351fddbdfd09f0a1a5eeef4afb44679bd39cd63
(cherry picked from commit 07817a412c6473a812c9c0a7014e45eba5c62a30)

commit_message:
Change default_disk value

CONF.default_disk's default value = -1 is just a work around
with no support disk quota fetature [1]. Now, we have an
actual fix [2] so we can change the default_disk value.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548508/4/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py@313
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549710/

Change-Id: I80b67b73b1f5b45c06f4482e564a6440e7f5e64f

commit_message:
Log health manager exceptions

The executor will hide any unhandled exceptions raised from the update_health
or update_stats methods. This patch updates the health manager to log those
exceptions.

(cherry picked from commit 24cd0070759fe094430d809167b2aa4964107a70)

Change-Id: I80fe5f49ddfc882b7d122048a6eb2e918aea8198

subject: Use local container meta-data
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-19 15:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['templates/meta-data/templates', 'templates/meta-data/create-message', 'templates/meta-data/expiry', 'templates/meta-data/config.5', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml', 'templates/meta-data/config'], 'message': "Use local container meta-data

The current lxc meta-data process is one where we download an archive
from the upstream lxc images and store it locally on the host. While the
archive is small, this is a process that can break due to transient
networking issues and is an external dependency that we don't need.

The meta-data for the containers we build is all the same between
distros so it's easy to replicate and maintain as a local dependency.
This change creates a templates meta-data folder and stores our
required meta-data items within it. With this change we'll ensure
all containers are built with the same capabilities without requiring
access to an upstream repo and will improve the general speed of
deployment due to the task simplification and removal of an external
dependency.

Change-Id: I999d7068ce05645c477408fbd40556427c202a40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use local container meta-data

The current lxc meta-data process is one where we download an archive
from the upstream lxc images and store it locally on the host. While the
archive is small, this is a process that can break due to transient
networking issues and is an external dependency that we don't need.

The meta-data for the containers we build is all the same between
distros so it's easy to replicate and maintain as a local dependency.
This change creates a templates meta-data folder and stores our
required meta-data items within it. With this change we'll ensure
all containers are built with the same capabilities without requiring
access to an upstream repo and will improve the general speed of
deployment due to the task simplification and removal of an external
dependency.

Change-Id: I999d7068ce05645c477408fbd40556427c202a40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
